data.title: A treat
data.text: My husband and I and three friends decided to eat here after BSO this afternoon because of the excellent reviews and the availability of parking.  We wanted a leisurely commute back to Cape Cod.  The service was superb--right from the start.  We had difficulty finding the place since the signs were not visible from our direction of travel.  When we phoned the restaurant the General Manager told us where to park and actually walked out to greet us...we were only 2 minutes away.  All evening the service was always friendly and competent.  We drank their draft ale special and our friends ordered a lovely French Bordeaux.  The bread served was good but not unusual.   The salads that we shared were thoughtfully prepared and very tasty.   The main meals were special as well.  Two of really enjoyed the recommended Haddock with parsnips and salad.  One of us took home some excellent Pork Shank.   My husband really liked the Wild Boar Ragu.  Only one diner was less complimentary about her meal of pan fried trout.  The prices were consistent with upscale dining.  My major disappointment was that the noise level increased significantly by the time we were preparing to leave at 7PM.   We would have preferred the music to be turned down as the room filled.

data.title: Just keeps getting better...
data.text: We've stopped in here a couple of times this year and the gang continue to impress.  Great bar scene and choice of drinks.  All different age groups just hanging out having a good time with cocktails and food.  Food was fantastic, we had the gnocchi and the pork and both were delish.  Great to have this type of place in quincy.

data.title: Leisurely and delicious
data.text: Excellent chicken salad sandwich. Sitting next to the window people watching in Quincy. Outstanding salad dressing.

data.title: expensive but nice terrace tables
data.text: great location in Quincy Center, food is good but over priced...small portions for salads...nice outdoor seating with umbrellas

data.title: Lunch in Quincy
data.text: Excellent food and service in the same building as Adams Historical Park tour. Try the Bob's Chicken or any of the shrimp dishes

data.title: A late night refuge
data.text:
Stopped in for the first time for a late (Thursday) night bite and drink at The Townshend. What a delight!. It wasn't crowded; we had a choice of tables.
We had the Fried East Coast oysters with Espelette aioli. Crisp, succulent oysters and the sauce was so delicious, I had to ask for bread to sop it up. We also shared the Pan-seared Idaho trout with seared potatoes, chorizo, leeks and beure-blanc. So, delicious!. The service was friendly and attentive. The beer selection is great. We're local; we'll be back.

data.title: Good but not great
data.text: Good food, small portion but not great. The food was good for Quincy and very creative. On our second visit the wait was not that long, the dinner was just ok.

data.title: Expensive and very plain
data.text: This is a very expensive place for the type of place it is-not even as atmospheric as McDonald's .  Looks like a college lunch room.  Food OK; best part was raspberry sorbet for dessert.  Glass of ordinary chardonnay was $12..  Absolutely not worth price or return visit.  Service Ok.

data.title: Great addition to Quincy Center
data.text: New spot in Quincy that has it all: excellent food, service and atmosphere. Great value for the quality of the food.  Staff was attentive without being overbearing and the vibe was very relaxed.  Favorite dish was heirloom tomatoes with fresh ricotta, which we shared.  Cocktails were original and delicious.  If Quincy Center can score a few more places like The Townshend, it may just become what it is trying to be. Went on a weeknight and had no trouble getting a table.

data.title: Really off night???
data.text: I've been hearing good things about The Townshend since it opened, so I was looking forward to checking it out. I'm hoping that the Townshend staff was just having a really bad night because my party of four had a pretty bad dining experience. The lowlights include some big things: I sent my skate back because it tasted spoiled and my husband got the wrong entree and had to wait while the correct one was cooked. Then there were some smaller things: some undercooked pasta, generally slow and inattentive service, even though it was a weeknight and not at all busy. At the end of the meal our server did bring us two nice desserts as an apology for the problems with our meal and he didn't charge us for the skate dish. But the experience was bad enough that we won't be going back.

data.title: Hurry up and eat!
data.text:
Wanted to try this rave -reviewed restaurant with foodie friends; Couldn't get a 7pm reservation-took the 6:15 -noted the restaurant was never more than 1/2 full when we left 90 minutes later.
Although they don't carry the liquor we requested-Tanqueray or Absolute-they do carry higher priced gins and vodkas and the rush was on to get us out before we finished the drink order! Dinner was served as appetizer plate was whisked away while I was still chewing the calamari.
The arancini and calamari appetizers were delicious! Portions are small, but delicious.
All the food was delicious, unfortunately we couldn't enjoy it because we were so rushed.
Ended up at the Fowler for a nacho and after dinner drinks because we were still hungry after paying $200/couple for dinner.

data.title: You will not be disappointed!
data.text:
Everything we ate was exceptional.  Roasted Carrots with whipped mascarpone-- delicious!  Arancini- fantastic!  Shrimp with a romesco sauce- delicious and fantastic!  Even the simple things like the fresh green salad and a charcuterie board were done with a noticeable attention to detail.  

Palmer is a master mixologist.  We sampled three different cocktails, all liquid works of art.   

Service was great too.

We will be back to try the rest of the menu items.

data.title: Very good!
data.text: The bone marrow and arancini were delic apps. The trout for dinner was amazing! The Bolognese was only ok. Loved the atmosphere and wait staff. I was cold and the waitstaff noticed and turned Ac down.

data.title: NOT EXACTLY WHAT I EXPECTED BUT VERY GOOD
data.text: Perhaps I am to blame; having read and heard about The Townshend, my expectations were very high. One a scale from 1 to 10 -- i would rate our experience as follows -- food 7.5...service 8....bar 9....ambience 5 noise level 5. I had the baked haddock, which was very good. The food was very good but the ambience or lack of it -- disappointed me. Too light, too bright, too bare. Hard to hear across the table. It was noisy though the restaurant was not crowded at all. Loved the bar and the bartender who made special cocktails for the table and was very knowlegable and fun to talk with.. I also loved the vintage cocktail glasses which added something special and fun to the experience. My husband had the hanger steak, which he said was delicious, our guest (who has been everywhere and has a very sophisticated palette) had pan seared trout and liked it but remarked that "it wasn't anything special." Good bread -- although it came out a bit late. The restaurant is located on the first floor of an office building. It is small and unpretentious, attracting a younger "trendy" clientele. The lack of ambience -- and the lack of warmth mattered more to me than I wish it had. Pricey and a bit more pretentious than it needed to be.

data.title: Great night...
data.text: It's a great spot right in Quincy Center with some outdoor seating.  It's not a big place, but great atmosphere and you can hear each other talk at the table.  Our waitress was great, she did not rush us at all.  (we had a party of 8) .  Because of our party size we were able to taste multiple dishes & apps.  Fried Oysters, grilled shrimp & pork belly apps. were excellent.  All of our main dishes were fabulous, the haddock & trout seemed to be the true winners.  For dessert we had the carmel salted & expresso gelato... They were so good.  Can't wait to visit again.

data.title: Fabulous Food
data.text: I'd been looking forward to trying this restaurant after hearing good things about it.  I had a wonderful  lunch there with friends.  The aranchini were crispy and delicious the beet salad with mandarin oranges and nuts yummy.  I ordered the Turkey club sandwich with fries.  The fries were probably the best I've eaten.  The sandwich was huge, served on slabs of artisan bread.  I enjoyed my leftovers the next day just as much.  Now to the dessert....hmmmm.  If you have room after your meal (that is why the half sandwich went home)...please treat yourself to the salted caramel ice cream served on the warm brownie.  Just a little bit of heaven.   The restaurant is cozy with very pleasant and attentive wait staff.  Definitely will be heading there for dinner in the near future!

data.title: Good food in Quincy Center.
data.text: Staff is great. Food menu is varied and delicious and beer selection is among the best I have seen. The Townshend is a great addition to Quincy Center.

data.title: Quincy needed a high end restaurant & got it!
data.text:
Being our 20th wedding anniversary,we wanted to go somewhere special,so on recommendation we went to The Townshend but not the last.
The food is beyond reproach,the server was especially attentive to our needs.
It is so nice that Quincy has a high end restaurant. The menu choice is limited,but what you get is top quality.

data.title: Finally, great high-end food in Quincy Center!
data.text: A welcome addition to the neighborhood, the townshend brings a fun cocktail menu and delicious diverse plates to Quincy Center.  I loved having lots of this type of restaurant around when I lived in Cambridge 7 years ago and it's great to finally see this type of atmosphere in Quincy Center now too.  I've been 3 times already since they opened and will be back again!

data.title: Trendy Little Restaurant
data.text:
Every time we go to this restaurant they give the best service, they take a team approach. Server is always attentive and very knowledgeable. They are always quick to offer up a beer, wine or food suggestion.

My favorites include Brussel Sprouts appetizer, Arancini is amazing and their Charcuterie Board options are exceptional. Prices are little on the higher end but you definitely get what you pay for. An exceptionally high quality meal. We will definitely be back. Great Job as always!
